conclusion: The magnetic flux \(\Phi\) through each turn of the coil varies sinusoidally with time \(t\).
The graph shows the magnetic flux \(\Phi\) as a function of time \(t\).

premise: The period \(T\) of the sinusoidal variation can be determined from the graph.
conclusion: The period \(T\) is the time for one complete cycle, which is \(6.28 \times 10^{-2} \, \text{s}\).

premise: The angular frequency \(\omega\) is given by \(\omega = \frac{2\pi}{T}\). Substituting \(T = 6.28 \times 10^{-2} \, \text{s}\)
The maximum EMF \(E_m\) is given by the formula \(E_m = m \cdot \Phi_m \cdot \omega\). Here, \(m = 100\), \(\Phi_m = 2.0 \times 10^{-2} \, \text{Wb}\), and \(\omega = 100 \, \text{rad/s}\).
